Dear ##SM_RULE_360 Email Salutation##,

When it comes to criminal justice reform, voters on both sides of the aisle agree: Change is needed. 79 percent of all voters in Alabama — regardless of party affiliation — say they're more likely to vote for candidates who support criminal justice reform.

This fall, we have a chance to make our voices heard at the ballot box. That's why we've made it easy to identify candidates who support criminal justice reform by launching VoteSmartJustice.org, a tool informing voters like you about where your candidates stand on criminal justice.

Visit Alabama's Vote Smart Justice page to get your voting info, an overview of Alabama's mass incarceration problem, and to see your local candidates' records on criminal justice issues from police brutality to extreme sentencing, and more.

For too long, our taxpayer money has been used to fuel the mass incarceration machine. In 2016, Alabama spent nearly half a billion dollars of its general fund on corrections. Meanwhile, we incarcerate so many people that Alabama's state-run prisons are operating at 164 percent capacity, making them the most overcrowded in the country. The time for our elected officials to act is now.

Check out VoteSmartJustice.org to learn your local and state candidates' views on these critical issues. Justice is an integral founding principle of this country — and right now, there's nothing just about our justice system.

Thanks for making your voice heard,

ACLU of Alabama
